subclassFeature.name: Steel Gust
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon and no other weapons or shields, if you have used your action to attack an enemy this turn, you can use your bonus action to attack that enemy again, building wind around you. On your next turn you may use your bonus action to release the wind forward, all creatures in a 15ft. cone must then make a dexterity saving throw with a DC of 8 + PB + DEX mod or be suspended in the wind, getting knocked prone, at 10th level they instead get incapacitated for 1 turn then knocked prone, this feature can not be used more than once per short rest or meditation, increased to twice per short rest or meditation at 10th level.

subclassFeature.name: Resolve
entries: The first time you hit an attack each turn, gain half the damage dealt rounded down as temporary hitpoints.

subclassFeature.name: Meditation
entries: Instead of short rests you may meditate for 10 minutes instead. During meditation you must consume a hitdie and then restore additional health equaling your Dex modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Last Breath
entries: Upon using Steel Tempest to incapacitate one or multiple creatures you may use your reaction to move and attack them regardless if you have movement left or not. This feature cannot be used more than once per short rest or Meditation.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Tempest
entries: Steel Gust now incapacitates for 1 turn then knocks prone, at 10th level, you can use Steel Gust twice between short rests or meditations

subclassFeature.name: Intent
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon and no other weapons or shields, you may forgo advantage on an attack roll to add a bonus to the damage roll of that attack, equaling 5 + the ability modifier used for the attack + PB

subclassFeature.name: Sweeping Blade
entries: As a free action, you may dash through an occupied space within 5 feet, then attack all creatures within your reach, if there is only one, attack them twice. This feature cannot be used more than once per short rest or Meditation.
